summary: @suitsongirls Hypothetically, yeah, it’s simple, but Poison and Steel are immune to Toxic so that wouldn’t work on them. Even...
body:
@suitsongirls Hypothetically, yeah, it’s simple, but Poison and Steel are immune to Toxic so that wouldn’t work on them. Even with a workaround, it’s unlikely your whole team packs Toxic, so if they manage to get rid of your likely one Toxic option, you now don’t have that option. Same with Taunt users. You’re probably only going to have one Taunt user, and if you bring them in when you expect safety and you’re wrong? Now they’re toxiced and on a severe timer, and Wish/Protect is indefinite. Boosting on a Protect is often the best way, and it’s the reason hyper-offense and stall are really the best playstyles. Again though, I don’t think stall shouldn’t exist. I just think that their near infinite healing and Protect nonsense is given too many uses to be fun. Stall teams could still function with half the uses, the only difference is we’re not waiting an eternity and a half now.

@axlcossack That’s basically what it is, yeah. You all can do whatever you want, but that doesn’t mean you are immune to consequences for your actions.

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Espurr and Meowstic
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Espurr and Meowstic
body:
677: Espurr

So, we just had my favorite domesticated dog Pokemon happen. So why not follow it up with my favorite of the common house-cat Pokemon as well? Espurr here is just total perfection. Nothing muddies the design too much, it has a short, sweet, and really effective and fun name. And it’s got a really fun basis on a popular cat breed, being a Scottish Fold! Known for their namesake folded ears. But clearly the thing Espurr is most famous for is that emotionally void face with glassy, blankly staring eyes. Espurr became one of the new “meme Pokemon” due to how hilariously creepy it looked. And it’s clearly nothing short of deliberate.

We all know the creepy psychic child trope fairly common in horror films, stories, and games. The Pokedex refers to it as the “restraint” Pokemon, and describes that it has ridiculously powerful psychic abilities that it struggles to control. Which is a trait pretty much straight lifted from said horror trope where said creepy psychic child has wildly out-of-control powers. It’s just a beautifully pulled off design with nothing but fun things to say about it. It’s even creepy but in a cute way!

Better yet, why make it a Scottish Fold of all things? Because if you unfold its ears, they reveal an extra pair of eyes. Well, they’re simply called “psychic organs” but they’re clearly meant to look like eyes. Not only is that a fun bit of horror, but it plays into the whole “constraint” aspect of Espurr as well!

Personal Score: 10/10

I’m telling you! The meme Pokemon are the best ones!

678: Meowstic

It’s a little sad that Meowstic drops the million-mile stare aspect when it evolves, but it’s still plenty of fun here. It at least keeps up a bit of the creepy child; perhaps now more like creepy teenager/young adult more than anything. With the rather disgruntled looking faces, especially on the female variant.

That, and they still got the eyes tucked away in their ears. Now even more blatantly eye-like! When they use special moves, their eyes even roll into the back of their heads as they reveal these big ol’ creepy eyes. How horrifying!

As is known of course, Gen 6 is the first Generation to make use of 3D models over 2D sprites. You’d suspect that, that fact would enhance Pokemon design in one way or another by making the Pokemon models far more dynamic than you could do with sprites. And while we may have to wait until Gen 7 to see them really get into the groove of taking advantage of the game being 3D now, there’s still a handful in Gen 6 that have the more dynamic models, the first being Meowstic and Espurr here! While it certainly wouldn’t be impossible for them to show their ear-eyes in a sprite, making it a definitive attack animation definitely hits home better.

Personal Score: 10/10

Perfect cats

Overall:

Such a neat and clever pair of Pokemon. No other cat Pokemon can compare!!

[Archive]

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Mountain Dewoxys Deoxys Attack Form and Mountain Dew fusion Nutritional Information: Sugar/Drink Type Ability: Fizz Boost...
caption:
Mountain Dewoxys

Deoxys Attack Form and Mountain Dew fusion

Nutritional Information:

Sugar/Drink Type

Ability: Fizz Boost -  Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.

Signature Move - Carbonated Whip - The user slaps the opponent with a fizzy tentacle. 100 Accuracy, 80 Power. Drink Type.

The Gamer Fuel Pokemon

Mountain Dewoxys was first created when scientists sent a bottle of Mountain Dew into space and it mutated. The presence of Mountain Dewoxys can help make gamers feel powerful and boosts their motivation. Its arms are not solid but hold their shape well when it needs to attack with them.

The 4th Halloween event fusion and we have Mountain Dewoxys suggested by @cr-tist.  I love this one.  What a funky alien boy.

blog.description: I tend to ping-pong a bit between fandoms and politics, but I do also circle back to them all the time.The main blog has everything, for specifics use the below links or just the tags.

summary: One thing Pokemon Zeta really shows in game design is how you can make railroading a little too obvious.  It is very clear when...
body:
One thing Pokemon Zeta really shows in game design is how you can make railroading a little too obvious.

It is very clear when the devs want you make you fight every trainer in an area…because the only successful route to the end will involve walking in their unmoving lines of sight. This was especially notable in the Team Plasma hideout, which was compounded by being cut off from a PC to optimize my team and constantly running back to a Nurse Joy near the start for healing. Think you can sneak by one by going another way? It’s a dead end, you have to go back and fight that person to go the right way.

It was less obvious inside Mt Press, which was instead more of an average slog. While it was on the long side, it felt more natural since there were ways to avoid a handful of trainers if I wanted to (spoilers: by the end I really, really wanted to).

The pacing of some areas needs work, and there’s some “difficulty via depriving you of healing unless you double back a lot” going on, but it’s still an impressive experience overall.

reblog.comment:
One thing Pokemon Zeta really shows in game design is how you can make railroading a little too obvious.

It is very clear when the devs want you make you fight every trainer in an area…because the only successful route to the end will involve walking in their unmoving lines of sight. This was especially notable in the Team Plasma hideout, which was compounded by being cut off from a PC to optimize my team and constantly running back to a Nurse Joy near the start for healing. Think you can sneak by one by going another way? It’s a dead end, you have to go back and fight that person to go the right way.

It was less obvious inside Mt Press, which was instead more of an average slog. While it was on the long side, it felt more natural since there were ways to avoid a handful of trainers if I wanted to (spoilers: by the end I really, really wanted to).

The pacing of some areas needs work, and there’s some “difficulty via depriving you of healing unless you double back a lot” going on, but it’s still an impressive experience overall.
